snippet: Over Israeli and American objections, the General Assembly approved a symbolic measure that allows the flag of Palestine to fly at the United Nations.
abstract: United Nations General Assembly votes to allow Palestinians right to fly their national flag in front of UN headquarters; symbolic move is opposed by Israel and United States.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rick Gladstone from New York; Aurelien Breeden from Paris; Diaa Hadid from Ramallah, West Bank; and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Over Israeli and American objections, the General Assembly approved a symbolic measure that allows the flag of Palestine to fly at the United Nations.

headline.main: Palestinians Get Approval to Fly Flag at United Nations
headline.print_headline: Palestinians Get Approval to Fly Flag at the U.N.
